柏.definition: used in 黃柏|黄柏[huang2bo4]; Taiwan pr. [bo2]

柏克萊.definition: Berkeley (name); George Berkeley (1685-1753), Bishop of Cloyne, famous British philosopher; Berkeley, university city in the San Francisco bay area, California

柏孜克里克千佛洞.pinyin: bǎi zī kè lǐ kè qiān fú dòng
柏孜克里克千佛洞.definition: the Bezeklik Thousand Buddha Caves, in the Turpan Basin, Xinjiang

柏崎.definition: Kashiwazaki (Japanese surname); Kashiwazaki, town in Niigata prefecture, Japan; Kashiwazaki, title of a Noh play

柏崎刈羽.definition: Kashiwasaki Kariwa, site of Japanese nuclear power plant near Niigata 新潟

柏林工業大學.pinyin: bó lín gōng yè dà xué
柏林工業大學.definition: Technical University of Berlin, Germany (Technische Universitaet zu Berlin)

柏舉之戰.definition: Battle of Baiju (506 BC), in which Wu 吳|吴[Wu2] scored a crushing victory over Chu 楚[Chu3]

柏蒂切利.definition: Sandro Botticelli (1445-1510) Italian painter of the Florentine school

柏遼茲.definition: Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique

柏鄉.definition: Baixiang county in Xingtai 邢台[Xing2 tai2], Hebei

柏鄉縣.definition: Baixiang county in Xingtai 邢台[Xing2 tai2], Hebei
